entry.title: Combined summary - [PATCH] Add spellcheck tool (requires `aspell`), also spellcheck.
entry.summary: The passage discusses various patches that have been applied to the Basis of Lightning Technology (BOLT) used in the Lightning Network. These patches aim to standardize pluralization for 'HTLC', explain channel reserve and the use of 'push-msat', describe how retransmission of any channel messages works, outline the unique set of keys used in each commitment transaction, and discuss the structure of an onion packet used in onion routing.The post on the Lightning-dev forum by ZmnSCPxj shared a patch for lightning-rfc on Github, but it was difficult to apply due to issues with line-wrapping and whitespace. Rusty, another member of the forum, fixed these errors, worked through spelling mistakes, and added a Travis check to prevent further introduction of errors. The final result can be viewed on the Github pull request page numbered 153.The passage also explains the process of forwarding a hashed time-locked contract (HTLC) packet through multiple nodes in the Lightning Network. It provides examples of error packets that can occur when forwarding an HTLC packet and discusses the process of blinding messages in the network.Furthermore, the passage covers the ways a channel can end: cooperation, force-close, and breach, and the handling of on-chain HTLC output. The official Noise protocol name for Lightning Network's variant is "Noise_XK_secp256k1_ChaChaPoly_SHA256".Lastly, the passage includes a script called spellcheck.sh that can be used to spellcheck files using Aspell, with the homedir being in the tools/ directory of the repository. In conclusion, the post on the Lightning-dev forum highlights the importance of collaboration in improving and standardizing protocols for the Lightning Network.
